item.title: Your Resume Wasn't Read. It Was Judged. (And the Judge Was Biased)
item.description: The promise of unbiased, data-driven hiring is a dangerous illusion. When we outsource recruitment to algorithms, we don’t eliminate human biasâ€”we just automate it, silently encoding the inequalities of the past into the future of work.

item.title: The Anonymity Paradox: When Survey Design Breeds Distrust in Data Science
item.description: Behind a seemingly routine course survey lies an ethical paradox where the pursuit of actionable data threatens the very foundation of trust with participants.
